1 /*global _: false */
  2 module.exports = function(AV) {
  3   var eventSplitter = /\s+/;
  4   var slice = Array.prototype.slice;
  5 
  6   /**
  7    * @class
  8    *
  9    * <p>AV.Events is a fork of Backbone's Events module, provided for your
 10    * convenience.</p>
 11    *
 12    * <p>A module that can be mixed in to any object in order to provide
 13    * it with custom events. You may bind callback functions to an event
 14    * with `on`, or remove these functions with `off`.
 15    * Triggering an event fires all callbacks in the order that `on` was
 16    * called.
 17    *
 18    * <pre>
 19    *     var object = {};
 20    *     _.extend(object, AV.Events);
 21    *     object.on('expand', function(){ alert('expanded'); });
 22    *     object.trigger('expand');</pre></p>
 23    *
 24    * <p>For more information, see the
 25    * <a href="http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/#Events">Backbone
 26    * documentation</a>.</p>
 27    */
 28   AV.Events = {
 29     /**
 30      * Bind one or more space separated events, `events`, to a `callback`
 31      * function. Passing `"all"` will bind the callback to all events fired.
 32      */
 33     on: function(events, callback, context) {
 34 
 35       var calls, event, node, tail, list;
 36       if (!callback) {
 37         return this;
 38       }
 39       events = events.split(eventSplitter);
 40       calls = this._callbacks || (this._callbacks = {});
 41 
 42       // Create an immutable callback list, allowing traversal during
 43       // modification.  The tail is an empty object that will always be used
 44       // as the next node.
 45       event = events.shift();
 46       while (event) {
 47         list = calls[event];
 48         node = list ? list.tail : {};
 49         node.next = tail = {};
 50         node.context = context;
 51         node.callback = callback;
 52         calls[event] = {tail: tail, next: list ? list.next : node};
 53         event = events.shift();
 54       }
 55 
 56       return this;
 57     },
 58 
 59     /**
 60      * Remove one or many callbacks. If `context` is null, removes all callbacks
 61      * with that function. If `callback` is null, removes all callbacks for the
 62      * event. If `events` is null, removes all bound callbacks for all events.
 63      */
 64     off: function(events, callback, context) {
 65       var event, calls, node, tail, cb, ctx;
 66 
 67       // No events, or removing *all* events.
 68       if (!(calls = this._callbacks)) {
 69         return;
 70       }
 71       if (!(events || callback || context)) {
 72         delete this._callbacks;
 73         return this;
 74       }
 75 
 76       // Loop through the listed events and contexts, splicing them out of the
 77       // linked list of callbacks if appropriate.
 78       events = events ? events.split(eventSplitter) : _.keys(calls);
 79       event = events.shift();
 80       while (event) {
 81         node = calls[event];
 82         delete calls[event];
 83         if (!node || !(callback || context)) {
 84           continue;
 85         }
 86         // Create a new list, omitting the indicated callbacks.
 87         tail = node.tail;
 88         node = node.next;
 89         while (node !== tail) {
 90           cb = node.callback;
 91           ctx = node.context;
 92           if ((callback && cb !== callback) || (context && ctx !== context)) {
 93             this.on(event, cb, ctx);
 94           }
 95           node = node.next;
 96         }
 97         event = events.shift();
 98       }
 99 
100       return this;
101     },
102 
103     /**
104      * Trigger one or many events, firing all bound callbacks. Callbacks are
105      * passed the same arguments as `trigger` is, apart from the event name
106      * (unless you're listening on `"all"`, which will cause your callback to
107      * receive the true name of the event as the first argument).
108      */
109     trigger: function(events) {
110       var event, node, calls, tail, args, all, rest;
111       if (!(calls = this._callbacks)) {
112         return this;
113       }
114       all = calls.all;
115       events = events.split(eventSplitter);
116       rest = slice.call(arguments, 1);
117 
118       // For each event, walk through the linked list of callbacks twice,
119       // first to trigger the event, then to trigger any `"all"` callbacks.
120       event = events.shift();
121       while (event) {
122         node = calls[event];
123         if (node) {
124           tail = node.tail;
125           while ((node = node.next) !== tail) {
126             node.callback.apply(node.context || this, rest);
127           }
128         }
129         node = all;
130         if (node) {
131           tail = node.tail;
132           args = [event].concat(rest);
133           while ((node = node.next) !== tail) {
134             node.callback.apply(node.context || this, args);
135           }
136         }
137         event = events.shift();
138       }
139 
140       return this;
141     }
142   };
143 
144   /**
145    * @function
146    */
147   AV.Events.bind = AV.Events.on;
148 
149   /**
150    * @function
151    */
152   AV.Events.unbind = AV.Events.off;
153 };
154
